meanings.definition: The action or fact of forming a united whole.
meanings.sent1: The cohesion of the team was evident in their seamless collaboration.
meanings.sent2: The cohesion of the ingredients in the recipe ensured a delicious outcome.
meanings.sent3: The cohesion of the puzzle pieces made it easy to complete.
meanings.sent4: The cohesion of the colors in the painting created a harmonious blend.
meanings.sent5: The cohesion of the students in the group project made it a success.

meanings.definition: The sticking together of particles of the same substance.
meanings.sent1: The cohesion of the molecules kept the liquid in its solid form.
meanings.sent2: The cohesion of the sand grains formed a stable sandcastle.
meanings.sent3: The cohesion of the dough made it difficult to separate the pieces.
meanings.sent4: The cohesion of the ants in the colony ensured their survival.
meanings.sent5: The cohesion of the fabric fibers made the material strong.
